Articles.Content:
Hey!

i just wanted to know if you guy keep the previous Updates for historical purposes or something!?

I collect em since 0.17

I have .13.3 .16 .17 (And followers) .18 (And followers) .19 (And followers) .20 (Is downloading eight now.)

I also have different ''versions'' of those versions e.g. Mods, Vanilla and stuff like that

I have versions from 0.17 upwards stored on a flash drive One day in the happy future, when this game will be finished, and polished and all around awesome i will install old versions and have a good laugh.
Its amazing to look back at those 0.17 crafts i did with my "noob skills", can't believe i got those huge things into an orbit^^
I can't believe I got ANYTHING off the ground even. No CoL, CoM and CoT being shown, so everything I did was guesswork.

I try to keep the zips of all the versions I've downloaded. I started playing around 0.11, but the earliest archive I can find is 0.13. I don't keep any of my old saves though. I don't get all that attached to the stuff that I make because I know that it's all going to change
I have .13, .15, .16, .17, .18, .19 and, when I get computer back after a month... .20! I keep them, plus their seperate mod install folders, probably totaling 8-13 different ksp folders, YAY!
I have nearly every update(and some experimentals) since 8.0 saved.
I don't as I consider my "job" is a playtester for KSP
Yes, I do! I have all versions since 0.15.
I found a download a while ago of 0.8.2, I think it was. I have that one, 0.13, and from 0.15 on except 0.16. Not sure why I don't have that one or 0.14.
I have an old 0.14.4 and some 0.17, 0.18 and 0.19 (vanilla + mods).
